text.div:
English

Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide hl7.fhir.uv.tools

FHIRToolExtensionsIG

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.uv.tools

This IG defines the extensions that the tools use internally. Some of these extensions are content that are being evaluated for elevation into the main spec, and others are tooling concerns

Spanish

Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide hl7.fhir.uv.tools

FHIRToolExtensionsIG

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.uv.tools

This IG defines the extensions that the tools use internally. Some of these extensions are content that are being evaluated for elevation into the main spec, and others are tooling concerns

name: FHIRToolExtensionsIG
title: FHIR Tooling Extensions IG
description: This IG defines the extensions that the tools use internally. Some of these extensions are content that are being evaluated for elevation into the main spec, and others are tooling concerns

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: Additional Binding Extension
resource.description: Extension definition for Additional Binding. Additional Bindings are in the R5 Element Definition; this extension is used in prior versions (instead of the R5 cross-version extension)

resource.name: IG Parameter
resource.description: An implementation guide parameter defined by the HL7 IG Publisher. This is used in R4 IGs where the binding to parameter name prevented the use of additional parameters

resource.name: IG Internal Dependency
resource.description: A package (id#ver) that this IG has an internal dependency on. A internal dependency is a package that is required to validate the resources in the IG itself but that is not required by the implementers of the IG

resource.name: Json Property Key Extension
resource.description: If true, indicates that in a JSON representation, the indicated child element is the json property key for the value. Implies that this is a property with max = * that has two children, one of which is the key and the other is the value

resource.name: Implied String Prefix
resource.description: A prefix value that is automatically prefixed to the value before it's validated (for use in logical models)

resource.name: Type Specifier Extension
resource.description: In some logical models, the type of content at one location depends on the value of some other element, and the type is otherwise not explicit in the instance. In such cases, the type of the element is assigned an abstract ancestor type, and this extension specifies how to determine what type is actually used

resource.name: Binary Resource Logical
resource.description: This extension specifies a logical model to use to validate the binary contents.

resource.name: CDSHooks Services Request (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Services response body. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDSHooks Request (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Request Body. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDSHooks Response (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Response body. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hook Specific Context (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Request Context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hook Specific Context for patient-view (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Patient-View context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hook Specific Context for order-sign (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Order-Sign context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: No Binding Extension
resource.description: This extension is used on elements of type code to indicate that it's deliberate and appropriate that they not have a binding. Typically, this is because they are contained by another type that does have a binding, but there are other reasons. This is provided to assist with QA processes that can use this to be informed where bindings are not necessary or appropriate.

resource.name: Binding Definition
resource.description: This provides a definition for a binding. There's really no functional difference between a definition and a description, and this extension will be removed in R6. No tools do anything with the binding definitions (they use binding.description instead).

resource.name: IG Page Name
resource.description: IG Page Name (for R4 or earlier - part of R5)

resource.name: Obligation Profile Flag
resource.description: Profiles marked to be 'Obligation Profiles' cannot introduce new structural elements or slicing, but they can change the cardinality, add additional bindings, and additional obligations on the elements that are already defined

resource.name: Inherit Obligations
resource.description: Inherit all the obligations from an Obligation Profile. The other profile must be a Obligation Profile (using [[[http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/StructureDefinition/obligation-profile]]])

resource.name: Select By Map
resource.description: This extension indicates that in addition to the concepts directly selected (either included or excluded) in the include/exclude statement, any source codes that are mapped to target codes that are selected by the nominated ConceptMapare also selected. The filter property can be used to restrict which types of relationships are included. Todo: If this is useful, it will be moved to the core extensions pack

resource.name: ValueSet Parameter Declaration
resource.description: This extension declares a parameter that can be passed along with an $expand or $validate-code invocation to further narrow the value set. See [Parameterised ValueSets](parameterized-valuesets.html) for further details.

resource.name: Binding Parameter Declaration
resource.description: This extension declares a parameter that is passed along with an $expand or $validate-code invocation, and where the value comes from. See [Parameterised ValueSets](parameterized-valuesets.html) for further details.

resource.name: CDSHookServices Example
resource.description: An example a CDS Hooks Service Request

resource.name: Test Cases
resource.description: A standard format for test cases used throughout the FHIR ecosystem

resource.name: No Order in XML
resource.description: Whether elements can come in any order in XML.

resource.name: CDSActionType Codes
resource.description: Codes that describe application CDSActionTypes

resource.name: CDSIndicator Codes
resource.description: Codes that describe application CDSIndicators

resource.name: CDSLinkType Codes
resource.description: Codes that describe application CDSLinkTypes

resource.name: CDSSelectionBehavior Codes
resource.description: Codes that describe application CDSSelectionBehaviors

resource.name: Additional Binding Purpose Codes
resource.description: Additional Binding Purpose

resource.name: Vocab Binding Style Codes
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Extension Style Codes
resource.description: How the type can be extended. Note that all FHIR types that inherit from ```Element``` have extension-style = fhir-extensions

resource.name: Id Expectation Codes
resource.description: Specifies whether a particular element or resource is expected to have an id or not

resource.name: IG Parameter Codes
resource.description: Ig Parameter Codes Defined by the FHIR Tooling. These parameter codes go in [ImplementationGuide.definition.parameter.code](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/implementationguide-definitions.html#ImplementationGuide.definition.parameter.code)

resource.name: Json Empty Behavior Codes
resource.description: empty-behaviour: what should be in JSON when a repeating elements has no items. Can be absent, present, or either

resource.name: Matchetype Mode
resource.description: How the type can be extended. Note that all FHIR types that inherit from ```Element``` have matchetype-mode = fhir-extensions

resource.name: ConceptMapEquivalence
resource.description: The degree of equivalence between concepts (R4).

resource.name: Viewing Hints for Rendering Engines (CodeSystem)
resource.description: Code that drives Snapshot generation behavior when copying extensions from base to derived

resource.name: Terminology Issue Type
resource.description: Codes that the type of an issue in the response to a $validate-code operation. The validator will handle some types of issues differently. In the absence of an issue type, issues are passed to the user without processing, and this may be confusing to users

resource.name: Type Profile Style Codes
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Viewing Hints for Rendering Engines (CodeSystem)
resource.description: Codes that drive Rendering Engine behaviour, to assist profiles and profile-based renderers to provide more useful human rendering

resource.name: CDS Hooks Specific Context for appointment-book (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Appointment-Book context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hooks Specific Context for encounter-discharge (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks encounter-discharge context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hooks Specific Context for encounter-start (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks encounter-start context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hooks Specific Context for order-dispatch (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks order-dispatch context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDS Hook Specific Context for order-select (Logical Definition)
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks order-select context. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDSHooks Services Base Extensible Element
resource.description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Services Element with Extensions. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

resource.name: CDSHooks Services Extensions
resource.description: This is a concrete subtype of Base that has extensions (though the format in JSON is different)

resource.name: Terminology Binding Style Extension
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Date Format String
resource.description: The date format, as a Java date/time format (todo: extract a common subset from FHIRPath? Java? DotNet? Windows API?)

resource.name: Date Validation Rules control
resource.description: A set of colon delimited codes that control the execution of specific valdation rules for date(/time) elements. The code ```tz-for-time``` controls whether the rule that there must be a timezone if there's a time is enforced - in it's absence, the rule is not enforced. The code ```year-valid``` controls whether the year is checked for being in the range 1800 -> now + 80 year - in it's absence, the rule is not enforced. If the extension is not present, the rules are enforced. This extension has no effect on data types and resources, only in logical models

resource.name: String Format
resource.description: The actual format of the string, to allow for additional validation. This usually arises due to layered content models. The format is the name of another primitive type

resource.name: Extension Style Extension
resource.description: How the type can be extended. Note that all FHIR types that inherit from ```Element``` have extension-style = fhir-extensions

resource.name: Id Expectation Extension
resource.description: Specifies whether a particular element or resource is expected to have an id or not. Note that this can be done in a profile on the element, but it is sometimes useful to say this e.g. on an abstract element in a logical model

resource.name: Actor Example URL
resource.description: An example URL used to refer to examples associated with this actor. This is used when an IG describes a federated system with multiple servers playing the roles of different actors. Note that this is for example references, and has no impact on the canonical URLs defined by the IG

resource.name: Actor For Example
resource.description: Used to associate an example in an IG with a particular actor that provides/serves this example (e.g. on a RESTful API)

resource.name: IG Link Dependency
resource.description: A package (id#ver) that has pages that this IG references, without depending on. The sole purpose of defining these IGs is to inform the publisher link checker that links to this IG are valid

resource.name: IGPublisher Load As Resource
resource.description: Instructs the IG publisher to treat this content model as a resource when it builds an IG (instead of treating it as a binary)

resource.name: IGPublisher Use As Resource Id
resource.description: Instructs the IG publisher to use this element as the resource id when it builds an IG (if there's no .id element)

resource.name: IG Publisher Bundle
resource.description: Instructs the IG publisher to load a bundle when loading the source, but to treat all the resources found in the bundle as independent resources in the IG (e.g. not a bundle). Use this for bundles of examples

resource.name: IG Dependency Comment
resource.description: This extension provides a comment explaining the why an IG depends on another IG.

resource.name: Binary Resource Format
resource.description: This extension specifies the format (= mime type) of a binary resource, when the binary resource is provided to the IG publisher as raw content (rather than as a FHIR binary resource with base64 content).

resource.name: Resource Fragment
resource.description: Defines fragments, possibly with ellipsed content, to generate from a specified resource for a embedding as part of resource pages.

resource.name: Defined Uri
resource.description: A URI defined in the IG that is (or may be) the target of an element with type URI. A typical use is for consent policies.

resource.name: Json Empty Behavior Extension
resource.description: empty-behaviour: what should be in JSON when a repeating elements has no items? Can be absent, present, or either

resource.name: Json Property Name Extension
resource.description: Provides the JSON property name for when the JSON name is not a valid element name, or on the root of a type to give the type itself an element name

resource.name: Json Nullable Extension
resource.description: If an element is labelled nullable, it can be present as a null value in the json. If this extension does not appear, a null value is treated as an error

resource.name: Json Primitive Choice Extension
resource.description: Marks an element as a choice of types where the type is implied by the JSON type. The only valid types at string, integer, decimal, and boolean

resource.name: Json Suppress resourceType Property
resource.description: If this extension is present and true, then the JSON format produced from this logical doesn't include a 'resourceType' property (and it isn't recognized automatically when reading the JSON format)

resource.name: Logical Container
resource.description: This extension is used in logical models to indicate that the type that can be the container of this definition. This can be a reference to an abstract definition, or a particular concrete definition. This is the (base) class encountered when %resource and %rootResource is found in FHIRPath constraint expressions.

resource.name: Logical Target
resource.description: This extension is used logical models to indicate that this type can be the target of a reference. This indicates that there is a persistence identity and maintenance lifecycle for the type, though there are no requirements for how those are defined.

resource.name: Matchetype Count Flag
resource.description: Marks that the named repeating element is evaluated only by the number of items, not by the contents of the items

resource.name: Matchetype Optional Flag
resource.description: Marks the element or a set of sub-elements as optional - they do not need to be present

resource.name: Matchetype Sort Rules
resource.description: Specifies how a list of elements is sorted prior to comparison with the matchetype

resource.name: Matchetype Flag
resource.description: Marks that this resource is a matchetype - an instance of data with extensions and primary values that specify a set of rules. Other resources can be tested against this.

resource.name: Package Scope
resource.description: Specifies the Npm Package scope for scoped packages. See how [FHIR Packages are scoped](http://hl7.org/fhir/packages.html) for further information

resource.name: Profile Mapping Extension
resource.description:
Extension definition for Mapping between ```API``` and ```Profile```. CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.profile has two different profile statements:

* profile - the overall system profile for a resource
* supportedProfile 0..* - a particular profile that the system supports

What is missing from this picture is defining which resources conform to
which profile. Sometimes, of course, it's impossible to define this, but
quite often, there's an algorithmic relationship that a server or client
could use to know that resources with a particular set of values will or should
conform to a given profile.

This extension defines a relationship between a search string and a profile.
Any resource that meets a given search string will be expected to conform to the particular profile. If more than one profile is nominated for a search string, resources SHALL conform to all the listed profiles. The last extension can be without a search matches and remaining resources

This extension repeats, and order is important - once a match is found, this profile is the one that applies. Todo: If this extension is useful, it will be moved to the core extensions pack

resource.name: Resource Sort Extension
resource.description: Allows assertion of a sort order for a resource in the list of artifacts within the IG

resource.name: Search Parameter Base Type
resource.description: Indicates the base type for a search parameter when the actual base type is not a valid resource (e.g. custom resource etc)

resource.name: Snapshot Base Version
resource.description: Specifies the version of the base definition that was used when the snapshot was generated

resource.name: Extension Snapshot Behavior
resource.description: Defines how an extension is treated when generating snapshots - ignore, add, override, defer

resource.name: Extension Snapshot Source
resource.description: Tracks which structure first defined an extension found in the snapshot

resource.name: Type Operation Definition
resource.description: Defines a function that is part of a type definition

resource.name: Type Parameter Extension
resource.description: Specifies a type parameter for the type it is on (for use with logical models). This can also be used to narrow the binding - that usually means, bind to a concrete class in a descendent of this type

resource.name: Type Profile Style Extension
resource.description: How profiles are applied to types (resources, data types)

resource.name: ValueSet Expansion Parameter
resource.description: A default parameter to use when expanding this value set. A client may also pass a parameter with the same parameter name; servers should either overwrite this default parameter, or add to the list of identically named parameters, depending on which parameter is named

resource.name: Viewing Hints for Rendering Engines (Extension)
resource.description: Definitions that drive Rendering Engine behaviour, to assist profiles and profile-based renderers to provide more useful human rendering

resource.name: Web Source
resource.description: This extension is for canonical resources to indicate where a human readable web page describing the resource can be found, if it's at a different location to the canonical URL itself. Todo: This might be considered for moving to the core extensions pack

resource.name: XML Choice Group
resource.description: If true, marks that this element is a choice group that doesn't literally appear in the XML; it only exists to group a set of repeating of elements

resource.name: Xml Element Name Extension
resource.description: Provides the XML element name for when the XML name is not a valid element name, or on the root of a type to give the type itself an element name

resource.name: Namespace
resource.description: Use this extension to indicate tha the element has an XML namespace different to http://hl7.org/fhir. The special value `noNamespace` indicates that there is no assigned XML namespace.

resource.name: CDSActionType Codes ValueSet
resource.description: CDSActionType Codes

resource.name: CDSIndicator Codes ValueSet
resource.description: CDSIndicator Codes

resource.name: CDSLinkType Codes ValueSet
resource.description: CDSLinkType Codes

resource.name: CDSSelectionBehavior Codes ValueSet
resource.description: CDSSelectionBehavior Codes

resource.name: Additional Binding Purpose ValueSet
resource.description: Additional Binding Purpose

resource.name: Vocab Binding Style ValueSet
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Extension Style ValueSet
resource.description: How the type can be extended. Note that all FHIR types that inherit from ```Element``` have extension-style = fhir-extensions

resource.name: Id Expectation Set
resource.description: Specifies whether a particular element or resource is expected to have an id or not

resource.name: ig-parameters Codes ValueSet
resource.description: ig-parameters Codes

resource.name: Json Empty Behavior Codes Value Set
resource.description: empty-behaviour: what should be in JSON when a repeating elements has no items? Can be absent, present, or either

resource.name: Matchetype Mode ValueSet
resource.description: How the type can be extended. Note that all FHIR types that inherit from ```Element``` have matchetype-mode = fhir-extensions

resource.name: Primitive Types ValueSet
resource.description: List of primitive FHIR Types

resource.name: SelectByMap Filter Codes (VS)
resource.description: select-by-map filter Codes - from either R4 (or previous) or R5

resource.name: Viewing Hints for Rendering Engines (ValueSet)
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Type Profile Style ValueSet
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary

resource.name: Viewing Hints for Rendering Engines (ValueSet)
resource.description: How the data type is bound to vocabulary
